page.title: 01General Review of Sorbie
page.content: On our allocated block, most of the land is{farming}land.Some of it is hilly and some is bog land but a lot of it is arable. There are eleven farms in the block and most of them are dairy farms. {Kilsture forest}is also in this block. It attracts tourists from cities because it has a forest trail which gives people a chance to view our countryside and wildlife. Quite near the forest there is a { {Creamery}. It is the main source of employment for the local people, who live in the village of {Sorbie}. Sorbie is a friendly, peaceful little village, situated in south-west Scotland in the region of Dumfries and Galloway. It is 13 miles from the nearest market town, called Newton Stewart. It is approximately 3 miles from the coast.
